intro: Selinum silaifolium, commonly known as silvery leaf selenium, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
